intro: Hibbertia serpyllifolia, commonly known as the common hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Hibbertia serpyllifolia is well adapted to arid conditions and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant.
